text: HIT wæs geworden æfter Moyses forðsiðe, Drihtnes ðeowan, ðæt Drihten spræc to Iosue, Nunes suna, & cwæð him to: Moyses, min ðeowa, forðferde; aris nu & far ofer ðas ea Iordanen, ðu & eal ðis folc mid ðe, to ðam lande ðe ic forgyfe Israhela bearnum.

Eal ðæt rymet ðe eower fotswaðu on bestæppað, ic eow forgyfe; swa swa ic spræc to Moyse, Fram ðam westene & fram Libano oð ða miclan ea Eufraten, eall Eðea land oð ða miclan sæ ongean sunnan setlgang beoð eowre gemæru.
Ne mæg eow nan ðingc wiðstandan on eallum dagum ðines lifes; swa swa ic wæs mid Moyse, swa ic beo eac mid ðe, & ic ðe ne forlæte.
Beo ðu nu gestrangod & ellenrof; soðlice ðu dælst mid hlote ðisum folce ðæt land ðe ic behet ðinum fæderum.

Beo ðu gestrangod & swyðe ellenrof, ðæt ðu mid weorcum gefylle ða æ ðe Moyses, min ðeowa, ðe bebead; ne ðu ne gebuh fram ðære æ on ða swyðran healfe ne on ða wynstran, ðæt ðu ongyte ealle ða ðingc ðe ðu dest.
Ic ðe bebeode ðæt ðu beo gestrangod & ellenrof; ne ondræd ðu ðe, for ðan ðe ic, ðin Drihten & ðin God, beo mid ðe on eallum ðam ðe ðu to færst.
Hwæt ða Iosue het ðæt folc hi gearcian to ðam earde to farenne, swa swa se ælmihtiga wolde.

& ðæt folc him behet ðæt hi him gehyrsumian woldon on eallum his hæsum, swa swa hig gehyrsumodon Moyse; hi bædon ða georne: Beo huru Godd mid ðe, swa swa he wæs mid Moyse, & se man ðe wiðcwyð ðinum bebodum ahwar, beo he deaðes scyldig: beo ðu huru gehyrt & hicg ðegenlice.

IOSUE ða sona asende twegen sceaweras digellice of Sathin, & het sceawian ðæt land & ða buruh Iericho, hu heo geworht wære; Hi ferdon ða & comon to anre myltistran huse heo wæs Raab gehaten & gereston hi ðær.
Ða wearð ðam cyninge gecydd ðæt ðær comon sceaweras of Israhela bearnum, ðæt hi ða burh sceawodon, & sende to Raab & het ða sceaweras agyfan.

Ac heo hæfde hi behydd, ær hyre seo hæs to come, on hyre upflora, & geandwyrde ðus: Ic andytte ðæt hi comon to me, ac ic ne cuðe heora fær, & hi urnon on æfnunge ut of ðissere byrig, mid ðam ðe ða burhgata belocene wurdon; efstaþ nu ardlice & ge hi ofridað.
Hi ða sona æfter ridon idelum færelde.
& ðæt wif ða spræc to ðam behyddum werum: Ic wat nu to soðan ðæt God eow sylð ðisne eard; witodlice eower ege is on us becumen, & ðis folc is geyrged & ormod ongean eow.

We gehyrdon ðæt Drihten adrigde ða Readan Sæ, ða ða ge ferdon fram Egypta lande, & hu ge ofslogon syððan twegen cyningas, Seon & Og, & aswearc ure mod, & ure gast forhtode to eowrum infærelde; eower Drihten is soðlice soð God on heofonum & on eorðan, ðe ealle ðingc gewylt.

Sweriað me nu ðurh Drihten ðæt ge don eft wið me swylce mildheortnysse swa ic macode wið eow, & syllað me sum tacn, ðæt ic sylf beo gehealden, & min fæder, & modor & mine gebroðra & ða ðe us to lociað, alysað fram deaðe.
Ða cnihtas hyre andwyrdon & mid aðe hyre beheton: ðonne ure Drihten us forgyfð ðisne eard to gewealde, we cyðað mildheortnysse on ðe.
Witodlice hire hus wæs on ðam wealle fæst, & heo let hi ut mid anum langan rape ðurh ðæs huses eahðirl ofer ðone weal.
& cwæð: Farað eow nu wærlice & gewendað to muntum & lutiað ðær ðry dagas, ðe læs ðe eow gemeton, ða ðe eow æfter ridon, & efstað syððan aweg.

Hi cwædon to ðam wife: We beoð unscyldige wið ðe, ðonne we to ðisum lande becumað, gyf ðu lætst ðisne rap hangian on ðam ehðyrle, ðær ðu us ut alete, & gelangast to ðe ðine leofostan frynd, fæder & modor & ðine magas, in to ðe.
& locehwa ut gange, licge he ofslagen, & se ðe on ðam huse beo, hæbbe frið mid ðe.
& gyf ðu abarast ure spræce, we ne beoð forsworene.
Ðæt wif him cwæð to: Eower cwyde stande.
Hi efston ða aweg, swa ðæt wif hi lærde, & comon to Iosue & cyddon him eal ðis.
Hi sædon him: To soðan us sylð Drihten ðis land; ealle synd geyrgede, ðe eardiað on ðisum lande.
IOSUE ða aras hraðe on ðære nihte, & astyrode his fyrdwic forð to Iordanen, & wicode ðreo niht wið ða ea on anbidunge.

& sende ða bydelas, & bead eallum ðam here: ðonne man eowres Godes earce styrað mid ðam gangendum bærmannum of Leuies cynne, & ge ne cunnon ðone weg, folgiað eow feorran ðære earce, & nan man ne genealæce neah ðam arce.
& beoð gehalgode; betwux eow Drihten wyrcð wundra to mergen.
& he cwæð to ðam sacerdum: Nimað ðis Godes scrin & gað ætforan ðam folce: & ða sacerdas dydon swa swa Iosue hi het.
& Drihten cwæð to Iosue: Nu to dæg ic ongynne ðe to mærsigenne ætforan Israhela bearnum, ðæt hi magon witan ðæt ic wille mid ðe beon, swa swa ic mid Moyse wæs.
& ðu gewissa ða sacerdas, ða þe ðæt scrin berað, ðæt hi gebidon on ðære ea.

Iosue ða clypode, & cwæð to ðam folce: Be ðam ge magon witan ðæt God wunað betwux eow, & ða hæðenan todræfð, ðe nu habbað ðisne eard on eowre gesyhðe, for ðan Iordan, seo ea, ætstent on hyre ryne; swa ðæt scrin in bið geboren, swa ofstynt se stream.

Ðæt folc ferde ða forð to ðære ea, & sona swa ða bærmen gesetton heora fotlæst on ðære ea ofre, swa ætstod se stream, & ongan to ðindenne ongean, swilce hit wære an heah dun, & se æftra stream arn ut to ðære sæ.
Hwæt ða sacerdas ða ætstodon on ðam grunde on drigre moldan on middan ðære ea, & eal ðæt folc ferde forð ofer ða ea be drium grunde.
& DRIHTEN cwæð to Iosue: Hat nu twelf weras of ðam twelf mægðum niman twelf stanas on middan ðære ea ðær ða sacerdas stodon, & habban forð mid eow to eowre wicstowe & wurpan hi ðær.
Ða dide Iosue swa swa Drihten him bebead, & cwæð to ðam folce: Gyf eowre bearn eow befrinað eft on uferum dagum, Hwæt doð ðas stanas her?
Þonne secge ge to andsware, ðæt seo ea Iordane adruwode, mid ðam ðe ure fæderas ferdon ofer hi mid ðam halgan scrine, & hi beoð her to gemynde Israhela bearnum a on ecnysse.
Ða dydon ða twelf weras swa swa Drihten him bebead, & namon twelf stanas on ðæs streames ryne; hæfdon forð mid him to heora fyrdwicum.
Iosue het eac ahebban oðre twelf stanas tomiddes ðam streame, þær hi stodon mid ðam scrine, & hi ðær ðurhwuniað oð ðisne andweardan dæg.
& ðæt folc ferde forð mid gebylde.
On ðam dæge gemærsode se ælmihtiga Drihten Iosue þone æþelan ætforan Israhela folce, ðæt hi hine ondredon, swa swa hi ondredon Moysen.
Mid ðam ðe hi ferdon fram ðære ea Iordanen, ða arn se stream forð swa swa he ær dyde.
& hi wicodon on Galgala, on easthealfe Iericho, on ðam teoðan dæge ðæs forman monðes.

ÐA geaxodon ða cyningas ðe eardodon on ðam leodscypum þæt Drihten ða ea Iordanen adrigde ætforan Israhela bearnum ða ða hi ferdon ðær ofer, ða wearð heora heorte toslopen & heora gast ne belaf on him, for ðan ðe hi ondredon Israhela tocymes.
Drihten cwæð to Iosue on ðære ylcan tide: Wyrc ðe stænene sex, & oðre siðe ymbsnyð Israhela bearn.
Iosue ða dyde swa swa Drihten him bebead, & Israhela bearn ealle ymbsnað uppan ðam beorge ðe is gehatenPreputiorum.
Heora fæderas wæron ær on Egypto ymbsnydene & seo iugoð næs, ðe be ðam wege wæs acenned on ðam langsumon færelde feowerti geara, & ðis is se intinga ðære æftran ymbsnydennysse.
Hi gewunodan ðær swa on ðære ylcan wicstowe, oð ðæt hi gehælede wurdon, & heton ða stowe Galgala.
Drihten cwæð to Iosue: Nu to dæg ic adyde þæra Egyptiscra hosp fram eowrum cynne.
Hi wurdon ða on Galgala, & worhton Phase, ðæt is færeldfreols, on ðam feowerteoðan dæge ðæs monðes on æfnunge on Iericho feldum.
& æton of ðæs landes wæstmum on ðam oðrum dæge, ðeorfe hlafas & polentan ðæs ylcan geares.
Æfter ðam ðe hi æton of ðæs eardes wæstmum, him ateorode se heofonlica mete; ne hi syððan ne onbyrigdon ðæs bigleofan ofer ðæt, ac of ðæs geares wæstmum Chanaan landes.
Mid ðam ðe Iosue com on Iericho lande, he geseah ænne wer wið ða fyrde standan mid atogenum swurde, & he sona hine axode: Eart ðu ures geferes ðe ure wiðerwinna?
Se wer him andwyrde: Ic eom ealdor & latteow Drihtnes heres, & ic hider nu com.
Iosue ða feoll sona afyrht to eorðan, & cwæð: Hwæt sprycð min hlaford to his ðeowan ðus?
Se engel him cwæð to: Vncnyte ðin gescy hraðe of ðinum fotum, for ðam ðe se stede is halig, ðe ðu on styntst; & he swa dyde.
HIERICHO seo burh wæs mid weallum ymbtrymed & fæste belocen for ðes folces tocyme, & hi ne dorston ut faran ne in faran for him.
Drihten cwæð ða to Iosue: Ic do ðas buruh Hiericho on ðinum gewealde & ðone cyning samod & ða strengstan weras ðe wuniað on hyre.
Farað nu six dagas symble ymb ða burh, ælce dæg æne & ealle suwigende; & seofon sacerdas blawan mid byman eow ætforan.
Iosue ða swa dyde, & ða sacerdas bæron ðæt Godes scrin ymbe ða burh, ælce dæge æne.
& oðre seofon blewon mid sylfrenum byman.
& hi ealle to fyrdwicon ferdon æfter ðam.
On ðam seofoðan dæge hi ferdon seofon siðon ymb ða burh.

& on ðam seofoðan ymbfærelde, ða ða sacerdas blewon, & ðæt folc eall hrymde, swa swa Iosue him rædde, ða burston ða weallas, ðe ða burh behæfdon, endemes to grunde, & hi ða in eodon, ælc man swa he stod on ðam ymbgange.

Iosue ða clypode, & cwæð to ðam folce: Sy ðeos burh amansumod & eall ðæt bið on hyre, buton Raab ana libbe & ða ðe lociað to hyre, for ðan ðe heo urum ærendracum arfæstnysse cydde & ge nan ðingc ne hreppon on reafe ne on feo, ðæt ge ne beon scyldige sceamlicre forgægednysse, & Israhela fyrdwic for synne beo gedrefed.
Swa hwæt swa her goldes byð, ðæt beo Gode gehalgod, & on seolfre oððe on are, eall in to his hordum.
Hi ofslogon ða sona mid swurdes ecge weras & wifmen & ða wepende cild, hryðera & scep, assan & ealle ðingc.
Iosue cwæð ða syððan to ðam foresædum ærendracum: Gað nu to ðam huse, ðær ge behydde wæron, & lædað ut ðæt wif, ðe eowrum life geheolp, & ða ðe hyre to lociað, lædað of ðisre byrig.
Hy dydon ða swa swa him gedihte Iosue, & læddon hi of ðære byrig mid eallum hyre magum, & hi syððan leofodon mid sibbe betwux him.
Hi forbærndon ða ða burh & ðæt ðe binnan hyre wæs.
& Iosue bæd ðus: Beo se awyrged, ðe æfre eft geedstaðelie ðas buruh Hiericho.
God wæs ða mid Iosue on eallum his weorcum, & his nama wearð gewidmærsod wide geond ðæt land.
WITODLICE Achar, Charmies sunu, Zabdies suna, Zares suna, of Iudan mægðe, behydde of ðam herereafe, ðe him forboden wæs, ðe Iosue amansumode; & se ælmihtiga God yrsode sona ongean Israhela bearn.

Ða sende Iosue sceaweras to Hai, ðe ðær gehende wæs, & het besceawian ða burh; Hi ferdon ða & comon, & cwædon to Iosue: Ne læd ðu eal ðis folc to ðære lytlan byrig, ac twa ðusenda oððe ðreo læt faran ðærto; Hwæt sceal eall ðis folc on idel beon geswenct?

Ða ferdon ðreo ðusenda feohtendra wera to oferwinnenne ða burh, ac hi wurdon on fleame & sona ofslagene, six & ðritig, fram ðære buruhware, ðe him on bæc filigdon; ða wearð Iosue swyðe sarig on his mode, & eal Israhela folc wurdon afyrhte for ðære dæde.
& Iosue feol astreht ætforan Godes scrine, & ða yldestan men ealle hi astrehton licgende swa oð æfen, & dydon dust uppan heora heafda.
Iosue ða clypode, & cwæð mid angsumnysse: Wella, min Drihten God, hwi woldest ðu lædan ðis folc hider ofer ðas ea, ðæt ðu us sealdest on Amorrea handum & us fordydest?
Ðis geaxiað Chananei & cumað hider to us, & ealle ðas landleoda belicgað us mid fyrde & urne naman adylegiað; & hwæt dest ðu, Drihten, ðinum mæran naman?
& Drihten him cwæð to: Aris nu, Iosue; hwi list ðu neowel on eorðan?
Israhel syngode & ða gesetnysse gewemde; hi ætbrudon of ðam herereafe, ðe him forboden wæs, & on heora hordfatum behyddon.
Nu næfð Israhel nænne stede wið his fynd ac flyhð underbæc, for ðan ðe he is besmiten mid ðære amansumunge; ne beo ic lengc mid eow, buton ge þone fordon ðe ðises gyltes sy scyldig.
& ðus secge ðam folce: Beoð gearwe to mergen: seo amansumung is on eow.

Gegaderiað eow be mægðum & gange ðæt gehlot fram mægðe to mægðe & be manna hiwrædenum & be ænlypegum mannum; & beo se forbærned, se ðe befangen byð on ðam fracodan gylte, mid eallum his æhtum, for ðam unrihtum weorce.
Hi samnodon hi ða be syndrigum mægðum, & eode ðæt gehlot swa lange oð hit becom to ðam ylcan men, ðe ðæt man gefremode, to ðam foresædan Achar, Charmies suna, of Iudan mægðe, & he wearð ameldod.

He andette ða Iosue ætforan him eallum, & cwæð: Soðlice ic syngode; Ic geseah betwux ðam herereafum wyrmreadne basingc & twahund entsa hwites seolfres & sumne gyldene dalc on fiftigum entsum, & ic atbræd ðæt & behydde on eorðan ætforan minum getelde.
Iosue ða sende sona to his getelde, & man funde ða ðingc, swa swa he foresæde.
& hi læddon Achar to <Achores> dene, mid wife, & mid cildum, & mid eallum æhtum, & hine ðær stændon & his ðingc forbærndon.
& worhton mid stanum ænne steapne beorh him ofer; & Godes hatheortnys gecyrde sona fram ðam folce.
DRIHTEN cwæð to Iosue: Ne ondræd ðu ðe nan ðingc: nim ðæs folces mæniu & far ðe to Hai: ða buruh ic ðe sylle & ða buruhware samod, þone cyningc, & ðæt land, & ða ðe lociað to him.
Do ymb ða burh, swa ðu dydest embe Hiericho; habbað eow ða huðe & ðæt orf eow gemæne; sete nu syrwa wiðæften ða burh.

Iosue sende ða sona on ðære nihte ðritig ðusend wera to ðæra searwa stowe, & het hi beon gearwe & anbidan ðær, & cwæð: Ic fare mid ðisum folce foran ongean ða burh; & þonne hi ut farað to us, we fleoð endemes; þonne wenað hi soðlice ðæt we syn geyrgede.
Ðonne fare ge to, mid ðam ðe we fleonde beoð, & gegað ða burh & forbærnað hi sona.
Hi dydon ða swa swa him dihte Iosue.
& he sylf on ærnemerigen mid ðam oðrum flocce to ðære byrig ferde beotlice mid wige.
Hi geseah ða se cyningc ðe sæt on ðære byrig, & gewende of ðære byrig mid ealre ðare buruhware & mid eallum his folce to gefeohte gearu, & nyston ða searwe ðe him sæton bæfton.
Iosue ða fleah, swylce he afyrht wære, mid eallum his here <andlang> <ðæs> <westenes>.
& ða oðre hrymdon hridende him æfter.
Drihten cwæð ða to Iosue: Ahefe ðinne scyld up ongean ðas burh Hai; ic ðe forgyfe hi.
He ahefde sona his scyld, & ðæt gesawon ða oðre, ðe lutedon on ðære dygelnysse, swa swa him dihte Iosue, & arison sona & ridon to ðære byrig, & hi ealle forbærndon buton gefeohte.
Seo buruhwaru ða beseah underbæc sona & gesawon ðone smic swyðe heage astigan, & ne mihton ðanon fleon ne forð ne underbæc.
Iosue ða geseah ðæt seo burh wæs gegan & feaht him wið sona & his geferan wiðhindon, & ofslogon hi endemes, ðæt ðær an ne belaf.
Ðone cyningc hi brohton cucene to Iosue, ðone he het ahon on heagum gealgum.
Twelf ðusenda ðær feollon on ðam gefeohte ofslagene, wera & wifa.
& Iosue worhte ða an weofod Gode, of ungeworhtum stanum, & his lac ðær geofrode ðam lyfiendan Gode, & Moyses æ geedniwode ætforan Israhela bearnum.
ÐES hlisa wearð ða cuð ðæra leoda cyningum ðe begeondan Iordane eardiende wæron.
& gesamnodon hi ealle anmodlice to gefeohte togeanes Iosue & Israhela bearnum.
Hwæt ða Gabanitiscean gamenlice ræddon, & mid geaplicre fare ferdon to Iosue.
Namon him ealde gescy & unornlic scrud & fynige hlafas, & forwerede fætelsas & geclutode bytta.

& cwædon to Iosue; We comon, leof, feorran of fyrlenum lande, & we gewilniað friðes & freondræddene wið eow; Him andwyrde Iosue & Israhela folc ðus: We nyton ðeah ge wunion her on neawyste hwær, & we frið ne nimað ðus færinga wið eow; weald ðeah eower eard us gesceote.
Hi andwyrdon Iosue & Israhela bearnum ðus: We gehyrdon eowerne hlisan, hu se lyfigenda God eow sige forgeaf on Seone ðam cyninge & on Og eal swa on Astaroth.
Ða cwædon ure frynd ðæt we comon to eow to eowre manrædene.
& we mid us namon nigbacene hlafas, ðe for ðam langan wege nu synd gefynegode, swa swa ge fandian magon.
Vre reaf synd forwerede, syððan we gewendon hider, & ure gescy geclutode, swa swa ge geseon magon, for ðam langsuman færelde syððan we ferdon ut.
Hi undorfeng ða Iosue, & ne befran his Drihten.
& hi ealle him sworon ðæt hi man slean nolde.
Hwæt ða ymbe ðry dagas wearð heora dæd cuð, ðæt hi on neawyste eardodon, & eall heora geapscype wearð ameldod Israhela bearnum.
Hi ne mihton swa ðeah ða men acwellan for heora aðsware, ac arodon heora life.
& Iosue him bebead ðæt hi bæron wæter to ðæs folces neode & to Godes weofode & wudedon him symle on gesettum timan; Hi bugon ða to ðam, & him wæs geborgen; & wunedon on Israhela on ðam weorce fæste.

HWÆT ða Adonisedech, cyningc on Ierusalem, sende to ðam cyningum on Ebron & on Hierimoth & on Lachis & on Eglon, & cwæð: Cumað to me, ic bidde, & bringað me fultum, ðæt we magon ða burh Gabaon oferwinnan, for ðan ðe hi gebugon to Iosue & Israhela bearnum.
Ða comon ða fif cyningas mid fyrde to Gabaon & wicodon ðær onemn, woldon hi oferwinnan.
Ða sende seo buruhwaru sona to Iosue biddende ðæt he come & ða burh geheolde.
Iosue ða ferde mid his fyrde ðyderweard.
& Drihten him cwæð to: Ne ondræd ðu ðe nan ðingc; on ðine handa ic hi betæce; ne mæg heora nan ðe wiðstandan.
Iosue him ða feng on mid gefeohte, & Drihten hi aflymde fram Israhela bearnum; hi feollon ða swyðe on ðam fleame ofslagene.
& God him sende ufan greate hagolstanas, & wurdon ma manna ofslagene mid ðam miclum hagolstanum ðonne hi mid swurde ofslogon ðæs dæges.
On ðam dæge bæd Iosue his Drihten, & ðus cwæð: Ne astyra ðu sunne of ðam stede furðor ongean Gabaon, & ne gang ðu mona ongean <Achialon> ænne stæpe furðor.
Ða stod seo sunne on ðam stede fæste & se mona gelice, oð ðæt hi aledon heora fynd.
Næs swa lang dæg ær ðam on ðisum life æfre, ne syððan on ðisre worulde, for ðan ðe God wolde ða fylstan his cempan & feohtan for Israhel.
Ða fif cyningas ætburston, & flugon to Maceda & behyddon hig on anum scræfe, hopodon to life.
Þa wearð Iosue gecydd ðæt ða cyningas ðær lagon behydde on ðam scræfe.
& he het ða sona wylian to ðam scræfe micele weorcstanas & beclysan hi ðærinne, oð ðæt hi comon eft & <setten> him weardas ofer, & gewende him forð.
Ðæt folc ða hit gegaderode æfter ðam gefeohte to Iosue to Maceda byrig, & nan man ne dorste on eallum ðam ymbwhyrfte acweðan ongean him.

Ða cwæð Iosue: Teoð ða cyningas forð ut of ðam scræfe & gangon ða yldestan to & ofstæppaþ heora sweoran swyðe myð fotum; ða dydon ða ealdormen swa swa him dihte Iosue, & ðara cyninga swuran forcuðlice trædon.
& Iosue cwæð eft to Israhela folce: Ne ondræde ge eow; ðus deð ure Drihten eallum eowrum feondum ðe feohtende beoð wið eow.
Iosue hi ofsloh ða & syððan up aheng on fif wacum bogum, & het hi byrian on æfen on ðam ylcan scræfe, ðær hi ær lutedon, & lecgan him on uppan ormæte weorcstanas.
On ðam dæge he gewan ða burh Maceda & ðone cyning ofsloh & acwealde his folc & on hyre ne belæfde nane lafe cuce.
Ða ðanon he gewende mid wige to Lebna & oferwan ða burh, & mid wige acwealde ðone cyning & ðæt folc, & ðær furðon ne belæfde naht to lafe cucu, ðe ne lage ofslagen.
Fram Lebna he ferde mid his fyrde to Lachis.

& Drihten him sealde on ðone oðerne dæg ða buruh on his handa & ða buruhwara samod, & he cwealde hi ealle & ðone oðerne cyningc, Hiram gehaten, ðe onette to ðære byrig him to fultume; ac he feol him sylf, & his folces nan ðingc ætfleon ne mihte.
He ferde ða to Eglon, & ymbsæt ða buruh.
& on ðam ylcan dæge he geeode ða burh, & mid wæpnum acwealde ða ðe wunedon on hyre.
Fram Eglon hi ferdon & fuhton on Ebron, & ða buruh oferwunnon, & mid wige acwealdon eal ðæt hi ðær fundon ðæs earman folces.
Fram Hebron he gecyrde to Dabira ðære byrig & hi aweste, & oferwan ðone cyningc & his folc ofsloh mid swurdes ecge, & ne let ðær to lafe nan ðing libbende.

Iosue ofsloh ða mid ðam sigefæstan here eall ðæt mennisc ðe on muntum wunode, & ða ðe on ðam suðdæle syttende wæron & on feldlicum wunungum, ðe he findan mihte, & Asedoch eac, mid eallum heora cyningum, & ælc ðingc ðe orðode, he acwealde mid wæpnum, swa swa Drihten him bebead, Israhela God.
On anre hergunge he aweste fram Chadesbarne, oð ðæt he com to Gazan, eal Gessen land oð Gabaon ða burh, & ealle ða cyningas acwealde & heora folc; Drihten soðlice feaht for hine & Israhel.
& hi ealle gecyrdon gesunde to Galgala.
ÐIS wearð ða gecydd ðam cyninge Iabin, ðe rixode on Asor, & he hraðe sende to eallum ðam cyningum, ðe cuce ða wæron on eallum ðam eardum ðe him ymbe lagon.
& hi anmodlice comon ealle mid heora folcum, swa mænigfealde swa swa sandceosel on sæstrande byð, ðæt hi mid ðære mæniu mihton oferwinnan Israhela bearn.

Ac Drihten cwæð to Iosue: Ne ondræd ðu ðe ðas mæniu; nu to mergen ic hi sylle on ðisre ylcan tide ealle to wundienne on Israhela gesyhðe, & ðu soðlice forcyrfst heora horsa hohsyna & heora cræta forbærnst.
Iosue com ða mid gecampe to him mid eallum his here, & hi hetelice sloh, & nan ðing ne belæfde libbende on him.
He forcearf ða hohsina ealra ðæra horsa & forbærnde heora cræta, swa swa him bebead Drihten.
He ferde ða to Asor mid fyrdlicum truman, & ða burh geeode, & ðær binnan ofsloh ðone cyning & ðæt folc ðe he ðær funde; Seo burh Asor wæs swyðe trum gefyrn & manegra burga heafod.
Ac hi forbærnde Iosue, & ealle hyre fæstenu hi fordylgodon mid fyre, swa swa Moyses him bebead, se mæra Godes man.
Ðæra burga huðe hi hæfdon him gemæne, & hi dældon ðæt orf, swa him dihte Moyses: ne forlet Iosue nan ðingc his beboda.
Iosue ða gewylde eall ðæt widgylle land manegra cyninga on muntum & on feldum, & ða cyningas ofsloh mid swurdes ecge.
Lange he wæs feohtende on fyrlynum burgum, & ælc buruhwaru wæs bugende to him, butan Eueum ana ðe eardodon on Gabaon.
Drihten hi gehyrde ðæt hi gehæfton wið hine, ðæt hi feollon on ðam gefeohte ætforan Israhela bearnum, & nane mildheortnysse ne begeaton, swa swa God bebead Moyse.
On ðære tide com Iosue & ofsloh Enachim on muntlandum Hebron & Dabir & Anab & of ælcum munte Iudan & Israhel, & heora burga adylegode.
Iosue ða gewann mid wige ðone eard, swa swa Drihten cwæð to Moyse on ær, & he dælde ðæt land Israhela bearnum, eallum ðam twelf mægðum; & ðæt gewin ða geswac.

ÐIS synd ða cyningas ðe Iosue ofsloh, & Israhela bearn, begeondan Iordane: þis is se æresta, cyningc on Hiericho, & ða buruh gewann; cyning on Hai; Cyning on Ierusalem; cyning on Hebron; Cyning on Hierimoth; cyning on Lachis; Cyning on Eglon; cyning on Gazer; Cyning on Dabir; cyning on Gader; Cyning on Herma; cyning on Hered; Cyning on Lebna; cyning on Odolla; Cyning on Maceda; cyning on Bethel; Cyning on Tapha; cyning on Afer; Cyning on Afeht; cyning on Saron; Cyning on Madon; cyning on Asor; Cyning on Someron; cyning on Achsaf; Cyning on Thenach; cyning on Mageddo; Cyning on Cedes; cyning on Iachane; Cyning on Dor; cyning on Galgal; Cyning on Thersa: ðæt is ealra cyninga an & ðritig.
DRIHTEN ða forgeaf Israhela bearnum eallne ðone eard, swa swa he behet heora ealdfæderum, & hi ahton hit syððan & hi ðæron eardedon & heora ofspring syððan.
God him forgeaf ða sibbe on eallum ymbhwyrfte & nan wiðerwinna ne dorste winnan wið ðæt folc, & ealle hi bugon to Israhelea manrædene.
& Drihten eall gefylde ðæt he him ær behet; næs nan ðingc aidlod ac wæs eall gefylled.
HI dældon ða ðæt land, swa swa him dihte Iosue, æfre be gehlote on eallum ðam burgum & on burhscyrum, ðe binnan ðam earde wæron, on wudum & on feldum, & feng ælc to his dæle.

ÐA æfter langum fyrste, syððan hi on friðe wunodon & Iosue ealdode, ða het he cuman him to Israhela bearn & ða yldstan heafodmen, & manode hi georne, ðæt hi Moyses æ on eallum ðingum heoldon, swa swa se ælmihtiga God him on Sinai ðam munte gesette & gedihte.
He bæd hi ða georne ðæt hi bugan ne sceoldon fram Godes biggengum to ðam bysmorfullum hæðengilde on ðæs folces wisan, ðe ðær wearð ofslagen.
HI ða anmodlice cwædon ðæt hi ðam ælmihtigan Gode æfre woldon ðeowian on eallum heora life, ðe swylce wundra gefremode on heora fæderum & on him.
Hi dydon eac swa on Iosues dagum & on ðæra ealdra dagum ðe æfter him leofodan, ðe ða wundra cuðon ðe God worhte on him.
Iosue wæs on ylde tyn geara & hundteontig, & he ða forðferde ætforan his magum.
& hi hine bebyrigdon on <his> gehlotlande, ðe lið to Effraim dune fram <norðdæle> Gaas dune.

Iosepes ban witodlice, ðe Israhela bearn <brohton> of Egypta lande, hi bebyrigdon on Sichem, on ðæs landes dæle ðe Iacob bohte æt Emores sunum, Sichemes fæder; & hit wæs gehloten to Iosepes bearna lande, for ðam ðe Iacob hit sealde Iosepe is sune æt is forsyðe.
